intro: Thyrsanthella difformis, commonly known as the variable thyrse, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, pale green to yellowish flowers arranged in a dense, spike-like inflorescence. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
